Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls and manipulates the pieces in their own ArrayList
    Author:
    Cale Short

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.awt.Color c)
      Create the ArrayList of pieces and set the color.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canThePieceMove(Piece t)
      Calls the parameter piece's calculatePossibleMoves() method, if that returned ArrayList is empty, set ableToMove to false, if it is not empty, check to see if the parameter piece is a king that can castle, and also leave ableToMove as true.
      void movePiece(Piece thePieceToMove)
      Gets the array of possible moves and prints out the choices for the player, asks the player to type in one of the choices, if the players's choice is in the list of possibles, go ahead and move there.
      Piece selectPieceToMove()
      Checks to see if the desired piece exists in the player's ArrayList AND if the piece is also alive.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.awt.Color c)
        Create the ArrayList of pieces and set the color.
        Parameters:
        c - For possible future implementation of awt.Color functionality.

    • Method Detail

      • canThePieceMove

        public boolean canThePieceMove(Piece t)
        Calls the parameter piece's calculatePossibleMoves() method, if that returned ArrayList is empty, set ableToMove to false, if it is not empty, check to see if the parameter piece is a king that can castle, and also leave ableToMove as true.
        Parameters:
        t - The chosen piece from selectPieceToMove() passes to Game.theActivePiece and Game.theActivePiece passes to this parameter.
        Returns:
        ableToMove

      • selectPieceToMove

        public Piece selectPieceToMove()
        Checks to see if the desired piece exists in the player's ArrayList AND if the piece is also alive. If those conditions are met, return theSelectedPiece. Continue until a piece is able to be returned.
        Returns:
        theSelectedPiece Becomes Game.theActivePiece

      • movePiece

        public void movePiece(Piece thePieceToMove)
        Gets the array of possible moves and prints out the choices for the player, asks the player to type in one of the choices, if the players's choice is in the list of possibles, go ahead and move there. If the player's choice is not in the list, set playerChangedTheirMind to true, and the player is sent back to choosing a piece.
        Parameters:
        thePieceToMove -
